config.question: Besides creating a pan-Indian military alliance against white expansion, Tecumseh and Tenskwatawa (the Prophet) urged Americans Indians to __________.

choices.content: demonstrate their legal ownership of lands that whites were entering
declare independence and form an alliance with Spain
adopt the whites’ culture and technology as a way of resisting further expansion
resist white ways and revive traditional culture

answer_3.response: Consider This: Tecumseh rejected classification as a Shawnee and may have been the first native leader to identify himself self-consciously as “Indian.” These men attempted to revitalize native cultures. See L.O. 8.1 How did the Republic’s growth shape the market economy and relations with Native Americans?
